description: This minimalist recipe looks toward Maryland with its Old Bay and chive accents, but keeps the sweet crabmeat front and center.
headline: Fresh & Simple Crab Salad

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The crab salad can be made one to two days in advance, but crab tastes best when it’s fresh. Given this recipe’s quick prep time, you’ll reap the most rewards if you make it just before eating. Storage: The crab salad will keep for about 3 days in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

name: Fresh & Simple Crab Salad
recipeIngredient: Serving options: lettuce leaves, halved avocados, or buttered, toasted hot dog buns

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the following, placing them in a large bowl: finely grate the zest of 1 medium lemon until you have 1/2 teaspoon; juice the lemon until you have 1 teaspoon juice. Finely chop until you have 2 tablespoons chives. Add 1/4 cup mayonnaise and 1/2 teaspoon Old Bay seasoning, and stir to combine.

Pick through 1 pound fresh jumbo lump crab meat for any shells, then add the crab meat to the dressing and stir until combined. Taste and season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper as needed. Serve plain or, if desired, on a bed of lettuce, scooped into halved avocados, or in a buttered, toasted hot dog bun.

video.description:
A favorite for an Easter lunch or a bridal shower celebration, crab salad is one of those dishes where less is definitely more. Fresh, succulent jumbo crab meat is sweet with just a hint of briny, mineral flavor; a good crab salad showcases the crabmeat front and center with minimal additional flavorings.
